fullText: Mrs. Doubtfire is a sweet-natured musical that delivers exactly what you'd expect—no more, no less. It's a competent adaptation that hits all the familiar beats without adding much theatrical magic.
dtliExcerpt: Mrs. Doubtfire is a sweet-natured musical that delivers exactly what you'd expect—no more, no less. It's a competent adaptation that hits all the familiar beats without adding much theatrical magic.
bwwExcerpt: Have I seen the new Broadway musical Mrs. Doubtfire? At this point, I am fairly confident that I have; ask me in three months, and I'm not sure what I'll tell you. This pleasant and forgettable show at the Stephen Sondheim Theatre is the epitome of what Sondheim (citing his friend Mary Rodgers) called a "Why" musical: "a perfectly respectable show, based on a perfectly respectable source, that has no reason for being."
